column8: I promise:

column1: There are moments I feel intense grief.
I’ve also never felt closer to my mother as a daughter or closer to her simply as a human. And she’s never been more beautiful to me than she is now—and she’s always been beautiful.

column6: MSW | @LSEalumni | #ActuallyAutistic #LGBTQ #Disability | 🏴;311792;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2022-04-12 02:56:12+00:00; ;1513712560901693441;en;0;0;0;0;Twitter for iPhone;@IndubitablyAcky *nodding* 💜

column1: When I said my stepfather “finally” called
column2: I meant it with great empathy. I imagine it was the hardest call and some of the hardest words in his life.

column1: Denial is his go-to psychological defense
column2: and challenging physicians isn’t in his nature.

column6: MSW | @LSEalumni | #ActuallyAutistic #LGBTQ #Disability | 🏴;311792;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2022-04-12 02:44:55+00:00; ;1513709722263818245;en;3;0;1;0;Twitter for iPhone;"@IndubitablyAcky Yeah

column2: care related to reduction of suffering rather than cure is supposed to be offered."

column6: MSW | @LSEalumni | #ActuallyAutistic #LGBTQ #Disability | 🏴;311792;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2022-04-12 02:43:10+00:00; ;1513709280440070144;en;75;0;1;2;Twitter for iPhone;(What I’m describing is a particular type of crying and death talk that’s part of the early stages of the death process. Patients know. Even patients with dementia or disease-related cognitive dysfunction know. They begin processing externally before
column8: turning inward.)

column6: MSW | @LSEalumni | #ActuallyAutistic #LGBTQ #Disability | 🏴;311792;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2022-04-12 02:34:42+00:00; ;1513707147825143813;en;106;2;1;10;Twitter for iPhone;"If I could make you docs working with patients with terminal conditions do ONE thing:

column1: Train your staff to prioritize calls reporting your patient has started regularly crying and talking about dying
column2: especially when that behavior is accompanied by significant functional change."

column6: MSW | @LSEalumni | #ActuallyAutistic #LGBTQ #Disability | 🏴;311792;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2022-04-12 02:22:40+00:00; ;1513704119986532362;en;153;2;1;5;Twitter for iPhone;"When it comes to end-of-life care
column7: considerations important in early life medical care become moot.

column1: My mother isn’t going to have time to develop antibiotic resistance.
It doesn’t matter if she becomes dependent on pain meds.

column6: MSW | @LSEalumni | #ActuallyAutistic #LGBTQ #Disability | 🏴;311792;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2022-04-12 02:16:22+00:00; ;1513702537551138830;en;137;0;1;5;Twitter for iPhone;"Above re UTIs:

column1: UTIs are common in the elderly
column2: especially when they lose touch with internal sensors and need the (less breathable) incontinence underwear.
disproportionate effect on cognition and cause delirium.

column1: An antibiotics Rx can prevent an ER trip."

column6: MSW | @LSEalumni | #ActuallyAutistic #LGBTQ #Disability | 🏴;311792;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2022-04-12 02:06:20+00:00; ;1513700011040821248;en;142;0;1;1;Twitter for iPhone;"I disabled replies because I am grateful for everyone’s support
column7: but I have followers who share my desire to be helpful.

column1: I just need to rant. I’m not in a place I can hear advice tonight.
This doctor’s appointment is a necessary step toward palliative or hospice care in Texas."

column6: MSW | @LSEalumni | #ActuallyAutistic #LGBTQ #Disability | 🏴;311792;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2022-04-12 01:56:25+00:00; ;1513697517606739971;en;157;1;1;4;Twitter for iPhone;"Also—again
column7: I’m no doctor—if you’ve been seeing someone with a terminal disease as a patient for over a decade and their loved ones and a caregiver with 30 years experience say they strongly suspect a UTI and ask for a Z-pack
column8: you need to just call in the damned Z-pack.

column6: MSW | @LSEalumni | #ActuallyAutistic #LGBTQ #Disability | 🏴;311792;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2022-04-11 23:53:28+00:00; ;1513666575945064456;en;310;5;1;14;Twitter for iPhone;"We handle end-of-life very poorly as a society here in the US.

MSW | @LSEalumni | #ActuallyAutistic #LGBTQ #Disability | 🏴;311792;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2022-04-11 23:51:42+00:00; ;1513666130413506568;en;163;1;1;4;Twitter for iPhone;"The pulmonologist’s office refused to fit her in
column7: saying her appointment in June was the earliest available.

column1: We were on the phone telling them “SHES PROBABLY NOT GOING TO BE ALIVE IN JUNE” but they were immovable.
I’ll have words after this is all over. No time now though."

column7: despite calling them out for their current failure
column8: I am no longer convinced political structures as they currently exist are to whom we should be primarily looking for leadership.

column1: I wrote about my thoughts in this regard in my “accidental anarchist” thread: https://t.co/4lwG4F25QW"

column6: MSW | @LSEalumni | #ActuallyAutistic #LGBTQ #Disability | 🏴;311792;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2022-04-08 17:26:03+00:00; ;1512481912782303238;en;218;5;5;50;Twitter for iPhone;"What we cannot do if we want to succeed against fascism—and
column8: this is what @TheDemocrats are doing—is appeal to nostalgia
column9: pretend everything is fine

column1: And normal is what got us here in the first place.

column6: MSW | @LSEalumni | #ActuallyAutistic #LGBTQ #Disability | 🏴;311792;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2022-04-08 17:21:05+00:00; ;1512480663240273920;en;96;0;2;12;Twitter for iPhone;"I continue to believe—even to hope—that those of us left of center can propose a better vision for the future than fascists. A future inclusive and driven by love rather than exclusive and driven by hate.

column2: we must first acknowledge the fear and name the real threats."

column6: MSW | @LSEalumni | #ActuallyAutistic #LGBTQ #Disability | 🏴;311792;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2022-04-08 17:16:36+00:00; ;1512479537422290946;en;74;1;3;22;Twitter for iPhone;"Fascists are VERY clear about their terms
column7: terms which further divide and oppress along racial and other identitarian lines.

column2: propose a solution based on their lies about the threats
column3: and appeal to ahistorical nostalgia to evoke a fantasy for the future."

column6: MSW | @LSEalumni | #ActuallyAutistic #LGBTQ #Disability | 🏴;311792;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2022-04-08 17:10:20+00:00; ;1512477960304881664;en;51;0;1;10;Twitter for iPhone;"If my memory is correct (I have not been able to find a source to confirm)
column7: I remember @BillClinton posing our challenges most succinctly years ago. He said something like (I am paraphrasing):

column1: The reality is we all have to share the world.
The only question is on what terms."

column6: MSW | @LSEalumni | #ActuallyAutistic #LGBTQ #Disability | 🏴;311792;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2022-04-08 16:53:29+00:00; ;1512473720060882944;en;98;1;4;28;Twitter for iPhone;"Yet we see political leaders who are left of center try this repeatedly. They fail because we know all is not well.

column1: A better approach would be to admit the presence of fear
column3: and present people with a vision of how we can create a better future."

column6: MSW | @LSEalumni | #ActuallyAutistic #LGBTQ #Disability | 🏴;311792;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2022-04-08 16:49:59+00:00; ;1512472835855421457;en;112;0;2;36;Twitter for iPhone;"Fascism is ascendant globally again in part because right-wing leaders admit the presence the fear. (They not only observe it: they inflame
column8: and distort it to serve their ends.)

column1: Left-wing leaders cannot effectively counter with false messages of “all is well.”"

column6: MSW | @LSEalumni | #ActuallyAutistic #LGBTQ #Disability | 🏴;311792;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2022-04-08 16:45:30+00:00; ;1512471710137729026;en;167;4;6;54;Twitter for iPhone;"Political messaging that relies on a “return to normal” or “everything is fine” approach creates a disconnect between our reality and the messenger.

column1: In times of great challenge and upheaval
column2: it does the opposite of calm: it sows distrust between political leaders and the people."

column6: MSW | @LSEalumni | #ActuallyAutistic #LGBTQ #Disability | 🏴;311792;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2022-04-08 16:41:52+00:00; ;1512470795494301700;en;76;1;1;14;Twitter for iPhone;"At our core
column7: humans are still closely related to animals who take shelter in response to seemingly undetectable (by us) shifts in barometric pressure or wind temperature or ground vibration.

column6: MSW | @LSEalumni | #ActuallyAutistic #LGBTQ #Disability | 🏴;311792;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2022-04-08 16:37:50+00:00; ;1512469781701701633;en;99;0;2;16;Twitter for iPhone;"The world is changing. People are feeling those shifts.

column1: Political and economic scientists and advisors spend a lot of energy trying to explain current disconnects between statistics of well-being and measures of attitude.
But human intuition is far older than human logic."

column6: MSW | @LSEalumni | #ActuallyAutistic #LGBTQ #Disability | 🏴;311792;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2022-04-08 16:30:09+00:00; ;1512467845338312710;en;77;2;2;8;Twitter for iPhone;"This thought was in my head fully formed when I woke up from a nap. (Yes

column1: Not being able to travel back to someplace you love is crushing

column2: but the ease of travel in the years since the fall of the Iron Curtain might not ever return."

MSW | @LSEalumni | #ActuallyAutistic #LGBTQ #Disability | 🏴;311792;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2022-04-01 03:23:06+00:00; ;1509733063621808134;en;0;0;0;0;Twitter for iPhone;@shrinkthinks Thank you

MSW | @LSEalumni | #ActuallyAutistic #LGBTQ #Disability | 🏴;311792;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2022-04-01 03:19:55+00:00; ;1509732263612882944;en;373;2;21;14;Twitter for iPhone;"Grief is not just a feeling. It is an all encompassing human experience.

column2: non-sudden death is not an event but an extended process.

column1: It is a journey of body and mind during which
column3: we travel with those we love.

column1: Not all the way though. Just to the gate."

column6: MSW | @LSEalumni | #ActuallyAutistic #LGBTQ #Disability | 🏴;311792;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2022-04-01 03:04:48+00:00; ;1509728457525284867;en;262;1;6;5;Twitter for iPhone;"I am deeply grateful I had enough time to heal and mature and to release our relationship from my unmet childhood needs and expectations.

column1: There is nothing unresolved. What could be resolved has been. What couldn’t be was due to capacity limitations not an absence of willingness."

column6: MSW | @LSEalumni | #ActuallyAutistic #LGBTQ #Disability | 🏴;311792;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2022-04-01 02:52:19+00:00; ;1509725318172581894;en;85;0;3;2;Twitter for iPhone;@Flamingogrrl I got in bed with my mother and cried in large part because I was truly worried I’d have a heart attack if I didn’t—and my daughter needs me to stay alive.

MSW | @LSEalumni | #ActuallyAutistic #LGBTQ #Disability | 🏴;311792;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2022-04-01 02:45:35+00:00; ;1509723620909662210;en;308;1;8;13;Twitter for iPhone;"I am so grateful to be able to be present with her on this last journey.

column1: When I went by plane to my grandparents as a very young child
column2: my mother would come with me to the gate—as far as she could go—and then she’d have to say goodbye and watch me leave alone.

column6: MSW | @LSEalumni | #ActuallyAutistic #LGBTQ #Disability | 🏴;311792;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2022-04-01 02:35:06+00:00; ;1509720983493566466;en;238;0;7;9;Twitter for iPhone;"We laughed
column7: and then I sobbed some more. So many layers of tears
column8: each with its own breath pattern and sound.

column1: She comforted me with her presence alone
column2: as only she can. I breathed in her scent deep into my lungs as though they were bottles I could cork and save to inhale later."

column6: MSW | @LSEalumni | #ActuallyAutistic #LGBTQ #Disability | 🏴;311792;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2022-04-01 02:31:14+00:00; ;1509720010121428992;en;217;0;4;9;Twitter for iPhone;"We rocked
column8: curled up like commas
column9: our movement almost imperceptible but nonetheless evoking the comfort of primal maternal rhythm.

column1: We laughed as I murmured a memory into her shoulder of her making me pancakes with bunny ears and my licking maple syrup off the plate."

column6: MSW | @LSEalumni | #ActuallyAutistic #LGBTQ #Disability | 🏴;311792;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2022-04-01 02:23:59+00:00; ;1509718187209801733;en;790;6;50;40;Twitter for iPhone;"Grief is not just a feeling.

column1: Hearts can actually break. I worry mine is. (I’ve always had low BP but have developed hypertension since my father’s death and along with my mother’s decline.)
I got in bed with my mama today—curled up behind her with my arms around her—and sobbed."

column6: MSW | @LSEalumni | #ActuallyAutistic #LGBTQ #Disability | 🏴;311792;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2022-03-24 20:48:27+00:00; ;1507097032116391942;en;16;0;1;1;Twitter for iPhone;@csharpepr Thank you.

column1: But he thinks if he just keeps yelling at her that her pulse ox is fine (when she’s on 4 liters of continuous supplement by nasal cannula) that it will help alleviate her sense of panic when her dyspnea is so bad she feels like she’s dying."

column6: MSW | @LSEalumni | #ActuallyAutistic #LGBTQ #Disability | 🏴;311792;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2022-03-24 20:37:51+00:00; ;1507094362563518472;en;5;0;1;0;Twitter for iPhone;"@sintax924 I’m sorry for your loss.

column1: My mother—even with the dementia—knows what’s happening.
But my stepfather is in denial
column2: and it makes it difficult to manage when he is getting incomplete information from the physicians."

column6: MSW | @LSEalumni | #ActuallyAutistic #LGBTQ #Disability | 🏴;311792;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2022-03-24 20:35:05+00:00; ;1507093666300583937;en;1;0;0;0;Twitter for iPhone;@AnarkYouTube Perfectly said

MSW | @LSEalumni | #ActuallyAutistic #LGBTQ #Disability | 🏴;311792;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2022-03-24 20:29:44+00:00; ;1507092319841005568;en;131;0;10;11;Twitter for iPhone;"No one prays more often or harder than I do that my mother will live for years.

column1: But it should not be on me or any family member to be the first to address the fact her progressive
column2: often fatal disease might kill her.

column1: Putting that burden on families only causes more stress.

column6: MSW | @LSEalumni | #ActuallyAutistic #LGBTQ #Disability | 🏴;311792;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2022-03-24 20:10:09+00:00; ;1507087393626759175;en;1;0;1;0;Twitter for iPhone;@lws3813 Thanks. So far her skin is holding up well

column1: She’s been very clear with all of us that she does NOT want intubation at this point.
(It’s been a frequent subject of discussion since the pandemic began.)"

column6: MSW | @LSEalumni | #ActuallyAutistic #LGBTQ #Disability | 🏴;311792;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2022-03-24 19:41:28+00:00; ;1507080176055767045;en;5;0;1;0;Twitter for iPhone;@jconstance61 Which is why pulmonologists should ask questions that go beyond lung function and cover things like the patient having recurring death ideation and losing continence and many other factors that are common parts of the last year of life to give them a more comprehensive picture.

column1: I bought her a handheld battery-operated fan because I read that the feeling of air on the face is helpful for some people at end stage."

MSW | @LSEalumni | #ActuallyAutistic #LGBTQ #Disability | 🏴;311792;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2022-03-24 19:27:14+00:00; ;1507076593868488723;en;101;0;9;10;Twitter for iPhone;"Instead
column7: the doctor deflected and said the next spirometry is scheduled for July.

column1: I am not sure my mother will still be alive in July.
Then the doctor recommended yet another treatment of a different periodic injectable treatment rather than palliative care.

column6: MSW | @LSEalumni | #ActuallyAutistic #LGBTQ #Disability | 🏴;311792;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2022-03-24 19:24:12+00:00; ;1507075830379425795;en;94;0;3;11;Twitter for iPhone;"At my request
column7: my stepfather asked about performing a spirometry
column8: which is a simple and low cost test used to stage COPD.

column1: My hope was this would prompt the doctor to talk with him and my mother about the stage she is in.
The doctor did not take the opportunity.

column6: MSW | @LSEalumni | #ActuallyAutistic #LGBTQ #Disability | 🏴;311792;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2022-03-24 19:20:33+00:00; ;1507074910367227908;en;267;2;6;36;Twitter for iPhone;"When you as medical providers fail to address the possibility of death and instead continue to suggest additional treatments
column7: you make the death process harder on your patients and their families.

column1: It is not a kindness to ignore death.

column6: MSW | @LSEalumni | #ActuallyAutistic #LGBTQ #Disability | 🏴;311792;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2022-03-24 19:18:22+00:00; ;1507074362012282892;en;160;1;6;14;Twitter for iPhone;"She has recently begun to say with regularity

column1: I know this is end stage. I know this is part of the death process. I believe we should transition to hospice care.
NONE of this has been addressed by her pulmonologist
column2: whom she has seen for years.

column6: MSW | @LSEalumni | #ActuallyAutistic #LGBTQ #Disability | 🏴;311792;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2022-03-24 19:16:25+00:00; ;1507073869143814149;en;103;0;7;11;Twitter for iPhone;"She now requires oxygen 24/7 and various steroid breathing treatments six times a day.

column1: She is largely bed-ridden but can
column3: walk about 10-20 feet with great difficulty.

column2: her vascular dementia is progressing quickly.

column6: MSW | @LSEalumni | #ActuallyAutistic #LGBTQ #Disability | 🏴;311792;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2022-03-24 19:13:38+00:00; ;1507073171761074190;en;321;6;26;68;Twitter for iPhone;"#MedTwitter: Please engage with your colleagues/institutions to encourage physicians to address death openly.

column1: My mother is in what appears to be Stage Four—and likely toward the end of it—of COPD. My step-father says her pulmonologist has never even told him there are stages.

column6: MSW | @LSEalumni | #ActuallyAutistic #LGBTQ #Disability | 🏴;311792;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2022-03-24 19:06:25+00:00; ;1507071354167832587;en;65;1;3;27;Twitter for iPhone;"It is infuriating that anyone who presents with clinical symptoms is dismissed this way.

column1: It is no longer the sentient being you loved.

MSW | @LSEalumni | #ActuallyAutistic #LGBTQ #Disability | 🏴;311792;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2022-03-15 18:28:23+00:00; ;1503800290654531584;en;2;0;1;0;Twitter for iPhone;@mgcwndw @Dtrumpjrjunior *Not “forgetting” as losing the ability to do *easily* at first—because of the multiple sequential steps involved—and often putting off as a result (that’s the part that can feel like overlap with ADHD/Autism) and then
column8: losing the ability to do at all without help.

column6: MSW | @LSEalumni | #ActuallyAutistic #LGBTQ #Disability | 🏴;311792;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2022-03-15 18:22:24+00:00; ;1503798785692127237;en;78;0;19;8;Twitter for iPhone;This is the opposite of what I wanted… https://t.co/QD5QSewk2b

MSW | @LSEalumni | #ActuallyAutistic #LGBTQ #Disability | 🏴;311792;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2022-03-15 18:16:10+00:00; ;1503797215441166346;en;6;0;1;3;Twitter Web App;"Update on London protest from yesterday:
MSW | @LSEalumni | #ActuallyAutistic #LGBTQ #Disability | 🏴;311792;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2022-03-15 18:06:13+00:00; ;1503794712385310724;en;1;0;0;0;Twitter for iPhone;@DrJaneDiesel Thank you
MSW | @LSEalumni | #ActuallyAutistic #LGBTQ #Disability | 🏴;311792;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2022-03-15 17:47:21+00:00; ;1503789966937182215;en;1;0;1;0;Twitter for iPhone;@patwaprofessa I’m not
MSW | @LSEalumni | #ActuallyAutistic #LGBTQ #Disability | 🏴;311792;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2022-03-15 17:36:38+00:00; ;1503787267399331840;en;4;0;0;0;Twitter for iPhone;@LucasFoxNews My deep condolences
MSW | @LSEalumni | #ActuallyAutistic #LGBTQ #Disability | 🏴;311792;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2022-03-15 17:35:14+00:00; ;1503786915413307397;en;203;2;19;64;Twitter for iPhone;Apparently
column7: we are now being left on our own in the middle of a pandemic: https://t.co/YmNTJ05jyh

column6: MSW | @LSEalumni | #ActuallyAutistic #LGBTQ #Disability | 🏴;311792;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2022-03-15 17:22:48+00:00; ;1503783788651950080;en;6;0;0;1;Twitter for iPhone;"@LesKnits @tzed250 Be gentle with yourself too. We don’t know what we don’t know.

column1: We transition from child to caregiver without a manual
column2: and it’s complex process in every way."

column6: MSW | @LSEalumni | #ActuallyAutistic #LGBTQ #Disability | 🏴;311792;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2022-03-15 17:08:58+00:00; ;1503780307459264523;en;1;0;0;0;Twitter for iPhone;"@tzed250 @LesKnits It really does.

column1: Another thing to remember is that they can’t reach around their bodies as easily as younger people can AND it can be very arduous (in terms of cardiac function) to hold up their arms long enough to shampoo

column6: MSW | @LSEalumni | #ActuallyAutistic #LGBTQ #Disability | 🏴;311792;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2022-03-15 17:07:09+00:00; ;1503779850359873542;en;36;0;2;3;Twitter for iPhone;"More helpful perspectives on how eating can change and what to look for in those you love are below.

column1: People with dementia will also sometimes stop recognizing what is and is not food.
My grandfather ate a decorative soap shaped like a flower because he thought they were candy. https://t.co/S3JeZuoIyH"

column6: MSW | @LSEalumni | #ActuallyAutistic #LGBTQ #Disability | 🏴;311792;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2022-03-15 17:03:11+00:00; ;1503778852417515527;en;2;0;1;0;Twitter for iPhone;@LesKnits @tzed250 (Which is what I ended up doing once I realized he didn’t know how to use the knobs to turn on water and adjust temperature. I finally found that out by prepping everything he needed to attract him into the shower
column7: at which point he asked “if I’d mind” turning it on for him…)

column6: MSW | @LSEalumni | #ActuallyAutistic #LGBTQ #Disability | 🏴;311792;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2022-03-15 16:52:39+00:00; ;1503776201743216642;en;50;0;2;2;Twitter for iPhone;"Eating is another area to look for changes.

column2: forgetting to eat comes on a bit later than what I’m describing

column1: The issue of spoiled and rotten food is important. Check for spoiled or inedible items and throw them away. https://t.co/rGREs48Wr1"

column6: MSW | @LSEalumni | #ActuallyAutistic #LGBTQ #Disability | 🏴;311792;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2022-03-15 16:48:33+00:00; ;1503775167436230658;en;3;0;0;0;Twitter for iPhone;@MommaJacy *nodding*
MSW | @LSEalumni | #ActuallyAutistic #LGBTQ #Disability | 🏴;311792;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2022-03-15 16:46:36+00:00; ;1503774676224561157;en;2;0;1;0;Twitter for iPhone;"@tzed250 @LesKnits Right?!

column1: I had no idea and assumed my father was on top of things (he lived with her)
column2: but he was trying to be respectful of his mom by not getting all up in her money.

column1: (He also was in early decline by then but I didn’t know it yet.)
I went through all the bags and found it."

column6: MSW | @LSEalumni | #ActuallyAutistic #LGBTQ #Disability | 🏴;311792;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2022-03-15 16:44:04+00:00; ;1503774039256584194;en;4;0;2;0;Twitter for iPhone;"@LesKnits @tzed250 Yes. They’ll reply with what are “confabulations” (not lies) to protect their psyche.

column2: telling them they smell doesn’t help. I did it
column4: now that my father is dead

column1: He really needed me to go run the shower

column6: MSW | @LSEalumni | #ActuallyAutistic #LGBTQ #Disability | 🏴;311792;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2022-03-15 16:36:59+00:00; ;1503772256799006728;en;2;0;0;0;Twitter for iPhone;@jodieohdoh @kazbaa I’m so sorry. It can be a lot.

MSW | @LSEalumni | #ActuallyAutistic #LGBTQ #Disability | 🏴;311792;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2022-03-15 16:36:12+00:00; ;1503772059469594626;en;6;0;0;0;Twitter for iPhone;@janetrosenbaum Interesting. Again with following sequences
column7: including narrative sequence. The decision-making is also executive functioning related.

column6: MSW | @LSEalumni | #ActuallyAutistic #LGBTQ #Disability | 🏴;311792;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2022-03-15 16:34:23+00:00; ;1503771603368386564;en;10;0;0;1;Twitter for iPhone;"@10holte LOL—yeah
column7: and lots of teens do too.

column1: Executive functioning is a beastly challenge at times 😊"

column6: MSW | @LSEalumni | #ActuallyAutistic #LGBTQ #Disability | 🏴;311792;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2022-03-15 16:31:34+00:00; ;1503770893083947008;en;3;0;1;0;Twitter for iPhone;@LesKnits @tzed250 My grandmother almost lost her house due to an unpaid tax bill for $700 that was in one of plastic the grocery bags that she tied into a neat little package every day to get to “later” and stacked on her dining room table.

MSW | @LSEalumni | #ActuallyAutistic #LGBTQ #Disability | 🏴;311792;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2022-03-15 16:26:34+00:00; ;1503769636839608328;en;63;0;2;6;Twitter for iPhone;"Stopping cooking can definitely be an indicator of executive functioning changes.

column1: It’s another task involving a lot of sequential steps.
My grandmother went from baking biscuits and cakes and jarring her own jelly to doing none of that within just a few years in her late 50s. https://t.co/unv1t7mE3z"

column6: MSW | @LSEalumni | #ActuallyAutistic #LGBTQ #Disability | 🏴;311792;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2022-03-15 04:22:27+00:00; ;1503587405500141574;en;6;0;0;0;Twitter for iPhone;"@jheartney *nodding*

column2: but also a huge identity issue for many."

column6: MSW | @LSEalumni | #ActuallyAutistic #LGBTQ #Disability | 🏴;311792;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2022-03-15 04:21:50+00:00; ;1503587248616488960;en;0;0;1;0;Twitter for iPhone;@aepotter Well done!
MSW | @LSEalumni | #ActuallyAutistic #LGBTQ #Disability | 🏴;311792;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2022-03-15 04:20:37+00:00; ;1503586946177769472;en;19;0;1;0;Twitter for iPhone;@inspiredjen I don’t off hand
column7: but I’m glad this thread helped highlight the issues and validate your concern.

column6: MSW | @LSEalumni | #ActuallyAutistic #LGBTQ #Disability | 🏴;311792;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2022-03-15 04:19:40+00:00; ;1503586706330693633;en;17;0;0;0;Twitter for iPhone;@Nutripod Exactly. This can happen with people who were fastidious at their baseline.
MSW | @LSEalumni | #ActuallyAutistic #LGBTQ #Disability | 🏴;311792;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2022-03-15 04:19:10+00:00; ;1503586580178550785;en;1;0;0;0;Twitter for iPhone;@WellsLeane *nodding*
MSW | @LSEalumni | #ActuallyAutistic #LGBTQ #Disability | 🏴;311792;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2022-03-15 04:18:49+00:00; ;1503586491980816391;en;1;0;1;0;Twitter for iPhone;"@SparksMom53 *nodding*

column3: etc. are all the realm of intact executive functioning."

column6: MSW | @LSEalumni | #ActuallyAutistic #LGBTQ #Disability | 🏴;311792;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2022-03-15 04:17:43+00:00; ;1503586213810388995;en;109;0;4;0;Twitter for iPhone;"@Toddorado I suspect hygiene changes have been pretty common during the pandemic. Also executive functioning has taken a hit for many of us.

column1: But it’s not because we forgot how and don’t want to tell anyone."

column6: MSW | @LSEalumni | #ActuallyAutistic #LGBTQ #Disability | 🏴;311792;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2022-03-15 04:15:45+00:00; ;1503585718769172486;en;2;0;1;0;Twitter for iPhone;@Beantari Yes—and that’s what they’ll often say. But
column8: it’s important to get under that water if physically possible.

column6: MSW | @LSEalumni | #ActuallyAutistic #LGBTQ #Disability | 🏴;311792;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2022-03-15 04:14:38+00:00; ;1503585437327183873;en;1;0;1;0;Twitter for iPhone;@ClarNiUigin Depression can have huge impact on executive functioning.
MSW | @LSEalumni | #ActuallyAutistic #LGBTQ #Disability | 🏴;311792;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2022-03-15 04:14:02+00:00; ;1503585288219766786;en;24;0;0;0;Twitter for iPhone;@moodyjm51 Go do it 🪥🦷💜
MSW | @LSEalumni | #ActuallyAutistic #LGBTQ #Disability | 🏴;311792;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2022-03-15 04:13:40+00:00; ;1503585196477714433;en;0;0;0;0;Twitter for iPhone;@TeriReedDavis That makes sense 💜
MSW | @LSEalumni | #ActuallyAutistic #LGBTQ #Disability | 🏴;311792;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2022-03-15 04:12:49+00:00; ;1503584981934870528;en;0;0;0;0;Twitter for iPhone;"@insomnimom15 Yes
column7: and teeth can look fine for quite a while as the gum deteriorates and then—seemingly all of a sudden—teeth start breaking and falling out. Distressing stuff.

column1: Very bad for kidneys too to swallow bacteria for years."

column6: MSW | @LSEalumni | #ActuallyAutistic #LGBTQ #Disability | 🏴;311792;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2022-03-15 04:10:44+00:00; ;1503584457206415361;en;2;0;0;0;Twitter for iPhone;@PublicEdTay *nodding*

MSW | @LSEalumni | #ActuallyAutistic #LGBTQ #Disability | 🏴;311792;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2022-03-15 04:09:52+00:00; ;1503584240428060672;en;60;0;0;3;Twitter for iPhone;"@kary_cee There are treatment options that vary based on dementia type.

column2: knowing earlier can help you work with them to improve their quality of life/overall well-being.

column1: (I know someone who almost lost their home due to an unpaid—unopened

column6: MSW | @LSEalumni | #ActuallyAutistic #LGBTQ #Disability | 🏴;311792;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2022-03-15 04:03:00+00:00; ;1503582510902661122;en;440;1;21;44;Twitter for iPhone;"Summary:

column1: Cognitive changes associated with dementia can begin MANY years before we used to think they do and affect basic self care skills

column3: the elderly can find it hard to ask for help.

column6: MSW | @LSEalumni | #ActuallyAutistic #LGBTQ #Disability | 🏴;311792;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2022-03-15 03:55:57+00:00; ;1503580734849695746;en;215;0;6;19;Twitter for iPhone;"From a caregiving perspective
column7: it can feel a little nuts to have an older person arguing with you for months about not wanting to bathe/shower and giving every possible reason.

column1: Until you realize they don’t remember how to use the knobs or even the steps to clean themselves.

column6: MSW | @LSEalumni | #ActuallyAutistic #LGBTQ #Disability | 🏴;311792;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2022-03-15 03:53:23+00:00; ;1503580091544125444;en;205;0;2;20;Twitter for iPhone;"However
column7: there are some elderly people who will give every reason they can think of about why they can’t or don’t want to bathe or shower or to bathe or shower right then.

column1: Here’s the important part: sometimes they’ve forgotten how and don’t want to admit they don’t know how.

column6: MSW | @LSEalumni | #ActuallyAutistic #LGBTQ #Disability | 🏴;311792;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2022-03-15 03:50:03+00:00; ;1503579253895581698;en;187;0;2;21;Twitter for iPhone;"The changes in bathing take many forms.

column1: Some are practical and unrelated to dementia. Lots of older people bathe less because hormonal changes reduce oil output. Some have warranted concerns about fall risks and are more hesitant accordingly (installing grab bars can help).

column6: MSW | @LSEalumni | #ActuallyAutistic #LGBTQ #Disability | 🏴;311792;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2022-03-15 03:42:33+00:00; ;1503577364835540993;en;239;2;6;22;Twitter for iPhone;"(In between changes in tooth brushing and bathing
column7: you might see them have more difficulty dealing with mail and bill-paying. Communications requiring sorting/prioritization—paper or digital—can become overwhelming. You might see piles of unsorted mail around
column8: for example.)

column6: MSW | @LSEalumni | #ActuallyAutistic #LGBTQ #Disability | 🏴;311792;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2022-03-15 03:35:19+00:00; ;1503575544910204928;en;265;2;3;27;Twitter for iPhone;"The tooth brushing issue seems to reflect an executive functioning change.

column1: Brushing one’s teeth is a very executive functioning intensive activity (lots of steps). It’s also something we do countless times.
It’s easy to imagine putting it off but still thinking you did it.

column6: MSW | @LSEalumni | #ActuallyAutistic #LGBTQ #Disability | 🏴;311792;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2022-03-15 03:31:42+00:00; ;1503574634331099138;en;237;0;2;21;Twitter for iPhone;"It is hard to think about talking with an elder about whether they brush their teeth. I encourage observation as a beginning.

column1: • Do you see/hear them do it? Is the brush wet after?
• Is the toothpaste or toothbrush ever replaced?
Observe over time before talking with them.

column6: MSW | @LSEalumni | #ActuallyAutistic #LGBTQ #Disability | 🏴;311792;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2022-03-15 03:25:21+00:00; ;1503573037832151043;en;251;0;3;18;Twitter for iPhone;"Again:

column1: The tooth brushing change occurred for people I know decades before other changes. They were in their 50s.
They thought they were still brushing their teeth because the toothbrush and toothpaste are still there. But they’re the same ones that were there for a decade.

column6: MSW | @LSEalumni | #ActuallyAutistic #LGBTQ #Disability | 🏴;311792;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2022-03-15 03:22:21+00:00; ;1503572282781970432;en;305;0;6;24;Twitter for iPhone;"The tooth brushing has been the first to go with some
column7: even happening decades before other changes while the person was in their 50s.

column1: They often have NO awareness they’ve stopped and will swear they just did.

column6: MSW | @LSEalumni | #ActuallyAutistic #LGBTQ #Disability | 🏴;311792;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2022-03-15 03:15:36+00:00; ;1503570583434502147;en;1476;27;54;390;Twitter for iPhone;"If you have aging parents and a family history of any dementia
column7: here are two behavioral changes related to impairment in executive functioning that I’ve found occur for some people FAR earlier than any memory issues:

column6: MSW | @LSEalumni | #ActuallyAutistic #LGBTQ #Disability | 🏴;311792;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2022-03-15 02:54:03+00:00; ;1503565158085443584;en;290;0;10;35;Twitter for iPhone;Being a warrior for social justice is a good thing
MSW | @LSEalumni | #ActuallyAutistic #LGBTQ #Disability | 🏴;311792;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2022-03-15 02:37:40+00:00; ;1503561035306909697;en;27;1;1;8;Twitter for iPhone;Come for the tiny wasp knowledge
column7: stay for the virtually invisible teeny teeny teeny tiny wasp knowledge in the replies: https://t.co/FcgKZyUIz5

column6: MSW | @LSEalumni | #ActuallyAutistic #LGBTQ #Disability | 🏴;311792;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2022-03-15 02:31:22+00:00; ;1503559450812166146;en;22;0;0;1;Twitter for iPhone;"@edyong209 @AdrienneLaF IM TRYING TO GO TO SLEEP HERE ED DONT DO THIS TO US AT BEDTIME

column1: (P.S. I will always love you for seeing and hearing those of us living in the void of post viral syndrome disability. So I’ll forgive you for the tiny wasp knowledge. Eventually. Tomorrow probably. Okay…now 💜)"

column6: MSW | @LSEalumni | #ActuallyAutistic #LGBTQ #Disability | 🏴;311792;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2022-03-15 02:26:45+00:00; ;1503558290801836032;en;9;0;2;0;Twitter for iPhone;@ErynnBrook HOW DID I MISS THIS ERYNN

MSW | @LSEalumni | #ActuallyAutistic #LGBTQ #Disability | 🏴;311792;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2022-03-15 01:20:38+00:00; ;1503541651704274946;en;19;0;2;10;Twitter for iPhone;Good exploration of the hard questions here by @djrothkopf. Scroll up to begin 🧵 https://t.co/WycjQAG6v8
MSW | @LSEalumni | #ActuallyAutistic #LGBTQ #Disability | 🏴;311792;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2022-03-15 01:14:47+00:00; ;1503540178681577477;en;27;0;1;6;Twitter for iPhone;"I see no lie

MSW | @LSEalumni | #ActuallyAutistic #LGBTQ #Disability | 🏴;311792;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2022-03-15 01:07:25+00:00; ;1503538322383286275;en;12;0;2;4;Twitter for iPhone;"I’m not at all sure about the theory in this thread
column7: but the possibility of it being true is disturbing:

column6: MSW | @LSEalumni | #ActuallyAutistic #LGBTQ #Disability | 🏴;311792;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2022-03-15 01:01:49+00:00; ;1503536915152359424;en;143;2;9;36;Twitter for iPhone;"I wish they had picked a more symmetrical animal because this briefly confused my mind’s eye.

column2: the tweet brought out the best of Twitter. Read the replies 👀🦒 https://t.co/Rd9Enpoqhi"

column6: MSW | @LSEalumni | #ActuallyAutistic #LGBTQ #Disability | 🏴;311792;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2022-03-15 00:57:22+00:00; ;1503535796728614913;en;11;0;1;0;Twitter for iPhone;@emilybell CANT WE HAVE ONE GOOD THING EMILY JUST ONE
MSW | @LSEalumni | #ActuallyAutistic #LGBTQ #Disability | 🏴;311792;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2022-03-15 00:54:48+00:00; ;1503535147513167874;en;0;0;0;0;Twitter for iPhone;@txflygirl Thank you!
MSW | @LSEalumni | #ActuallyAutistic #LGBTQ #Disability | 🏴;311792;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2022-03-15 00:34:36+00:00; ;1503530063916109828;en;0;0;0;0;Twitter for iPhone;@moot75 That looks great! 😊

MSW | @LSEalumni | #ActuallyAutistic #LGBTQ #Disability | 🏴;311792;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2022-03-15 00:21:47+00:00; ;1503526842082467844;en;5;0;0;0;Twitter for iPhone;"@BGrueskin @froomkin Yeah. Lots of “pick me” girl energy in the piece too. It just felt whiny and self-indulgent to me
column7: but that’s become a hallmark of pieces like this.

column1: Way too many words to say
column2: “I want to give my opinion but don’t want people to be mad at me.”"

column6: MSW | @LSEalumni | #ActuallyAutistic #LGBTQ #Disability | 🏴;311792;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2022-03-15 00:16:31+00:00; ;1503525513985466376;en;4;0;1;4;Twitter for iPhone;"Very interesting—not surprising

column1: Most of the Chinese readout about the US/China meeting concerns Taiwan. There is minimal language (and no details) about Ukraine
column2: and Russia isn’t mentioned by name. https://t.co/41DMk6n1IA"

column6: MSW | @LSEalumni | #ActuallyAutistic #LGBTQ #Disability | 🏴;311792;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2022-03-15 00:12:26+00:00; ;1503524485068120064;en;4;0;0;1;Twitter for iPhone;@lrozen Mostly about Taiwan. Interesting (not surprising
MSW | @LSEalumni | #ActuallyAutistic #LGBTQ #Disability | 🏴;311792;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2022-03-15 00:07:16+00:00; ;1503523185253400584;en;3;0;0;0;Twitter for iPhone;@BGrueskin @froomkin I would
column8: have been interested in reading a article about any of the unidentified subjects she’s purportedly afraid to write about and am puzzled why her editors didn’t return this one in draft form and ask her to write one of those pieces instead.

column7: my Intourist roommates and I were quietly talking in our hotel room about how awful the TP was.

column1: The next morning our Intourist guide approached us to say she understood we had complaints about the TP.
That’s how we knew our rooms were bugged."

column6: MSW | @LSEalumni | #ActuallyAutistic #LGBTQ #Disability | 🏴;311792;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2022-03-11 06:05:08+00:00; ;1502163695291432962;en;7;0;1;0;Twitter for iPhone;"@baddestmamajama It’s a notoriously fowl disorder.

column6: MSW | @LSEalumni | #ActuallyAutistic #LGBTQ #Disability | 🏴;311792;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2022-03-11 06:01:14+00:00; ;1502162715908837379;en;6;0;1;0;Twitter for iPhone;@NovelSci (I don’t know if you saw my first reply to you I deleted

column8: lol. And then following up with an excited welcoming tweet
column9: lol. I deleted
column11: tried again. Just in case you aren’t.) https://t.co/LKc2upsMvo

column6: MSW | @LSEalumni | #ActuallyAutistic #LGBTQ #Disability | 🏴;311792;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2022-03-11 05:59:03+00:00; ;1502162164269809665;en;7;0;1;0;Twitter for iPhone;"@NovelSci I did all the online ASD screenings
column7: and a full developmental on myself going back to infancy. It was all there and clear once I laid it out.

column2: not unlike coming out to myself and others as queer.

column7: dysautonomia can effect your body’s ability to adjust your pulse/BP and it can effect its ability to respond to temperature changes.

column1: I used to love a HOT shower. I can’t do that anymore.
And even bathing the way I describe exhausts me for many hours.

column6: MSW | @LSEalumni | #ActuallyAutistic #LGBTQ #Disability | 🏴;311792;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2022-02-18 21:13:17+00:00; ;1494782093498658818;en;70;0;3;0;Twitter for iPhone;"@GenePark Like you
column7: I have difficulties lifting my arms above my head for any extended period
column8: even just long enough to brush my hair
column9: much less to wash it standing in a shower.

column1: I also make sure my daughter is home when I do bathe in case I pass out.
You are not alone and are valued.

column6: MSW | @LSEalumni | #ActuallyAutistic #LGBTQ #Disability | 🏴;311792;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2022-02-18 21:10:39+00:00; ;1494781430693568512;en;144;0;6;4;Twitter for iPhone;"@GenePark I won’t mention how often I bathe/wash my hair now because it varies greatly based on my capacity—but it’s not often. column8: and dry shampoo to stay clean in between.

column1: All VERY common in the disability community

column2: but she’s not in pain. She could still have months—or just days.

column1: Similar situations if I use “home” or “latest.”

column6: MSW | @LSEalumni | #ActuallyAutistic #LGBTQ #Disability | 🏴;311792;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2022-01-29 23:48:49+00:00; ;1487573476168900608;en;73;1;7;22;Twitter for iPhone;"There is emerging evidence that SARS-CoV-2 infection causes reactivation of Epstein-Barr virus in some people who develop #LongCOVID
column7: which might explain why there is significant overlap between the two post-viral syndrome conditions subsets (#POTS
column8: #MECFS
column9: #MCAS

column6: MSW | @LSEalumni | #ActuallyAutistic #LGBTQ #Disability | 🏴;311792;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2022-01-29 23:44:00+00:00; ;1487572267483770889;en;35;0;1;7;Twitter for iPhone;"IF a better study (see @HZiauddeen’s 🧵) finds that #LongCOVID in children is not as prevalent as in adults
column7: research should explore whether or not that’s related to the possibility of a lower rate of previous Epstein-Barr infection (and COVID-related reactivation) in youth.

column7: please know how life-changing this phrase can be.

column1: I understand you are taught to think “horses
column2: not zebras” when you hear hoofbeats
column3: but some of us are out here living with “zebra” bodies.

column1: All we want is a doctor who believes us and tries.

column1: I hope you will read it.
The elimination of subgroupings has been huge positive
column2: and the existing qualifiers are sufficient. https://t.co/lfn57qQhUd"

Parents and clinicians/service providers caring for autistics with greater support needs deserve more help. So do autistics in their care.

column1: So do those of us with fewer support needs.
We are in a stronger position advocating together as a community instead of separately.

column6: MSW | @LSEalumni | #ActuallyAutistic #LGBTQ #Disability | 🏴;311792;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2022-01-29 20:28:59+00:00; ;1487523187583823877;en;6;0;1;0;Twitter for iPhone;"@ExistentialAut1 3. column1: It is unethical to label one’s child/patient differently to say

column6: MSW | @LSEalumni | #ActuallyAutistic #LGBTQ #Disability | 🏴;311792;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2022-01-29 20:20:17+00:00; ;1487520999214092291;en;8;0;1;0;Twitter for iPhone;"@ExistentialAut1 2. column8: is a dynamic that creates distance based on perceived functioning.

column6: MSW | @LSEalumni | #ActuallyAutistic #LGBTQ #Disability | 🏴;311792;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2022-01-29 20:14:14+00:00; ;1487519474274209794;en;12;0;1;0;Twitter for iPhone;"@ExistentialAut1 No.

column1: 1. The impact of sub-grouping will be to distance those in our community with greater support needs from those in our community with lesser support needs. I worry such distancing will make those with greater support needs even more vulnerable than they already are.

column6: MSW | @LSEalumni | #ActuallyAutistic #LGBTQ #Disability | 🏴;311792;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2022-01-24 00:59:59+00:00; ;1485417058854711297;en;23;0;1;2;Twitter for iPhone;"Biden is seen as a relative “dove” in the world of realpolitik.

column1: His follow-through on the withdrawal of US troops from Afghanistan (a decision I support) was viewed by some in that vein.
Biden is currently being tested by Putin vis a vis Ukraine AND by Xi vis a vis Taiwan."

column6: MSW | @LSEalumni | #ActuallyAutistic #LGBTQ #Disability | 🏴;311792;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2022-01-24 00:56:28+00:00; ;1485416176020828162;en;31;0;2;6;Twitter for iPhone;"Biden will also likely approve some kind of US military movements

column6: MSW | @LSEalumni | #ActuallyAutistic #LGBTQ #Disability | 🏴;311792;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2022-01-24 00:49:50+00:00; ;1485414507195285507;en;29;1;3;3;Twitter for iPhone;"@Celestephase @sarahkendzior She used a combination of inflammatory language to get people’s emotions high so they don’t think clearly AND throwing-spaghetti-at-the-wall rhetoric where everything is so mixed up that it’s impossible to track and hold her accountable.

column1: In other words: confusion was the goal."

column6: MSW | @LSEalumni | #ActuallyAutistic #LGBTQ #Disability | 🏴;311792;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2022-01-24 00:30:11+00:00; ;1485409562198953987;en;9;0;1;1;Twitter for iPhone;"@nicole_chenelle One thing I observed in 2017 has since become what I’ve found to be a reliable way to discern operatives from activists:

column1: Operatives often express glee about what are actually alarming developments (it’s a game to them).

column6: MSW | @LSEalumni | #ActuallyAutistic #LGBTQ #Disability | 🏴;311792;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2022-01-24 00:16:47+00:00; ;1485406186614710274;en;7;0;2;1;Twitter for iPhone;"@nicole_chenelle Her primary goals (and
column8: achievements) appeared to be:

column1: 1. Discourage necessary activism by telling everyone that rescue was coming and all they had to do was wait; and
2. Delegitimize the facts of the conspiracy by mixing them in with her fabulist narratives."

column6: MSW | @LSEalumni | #ActuallyAutistic #LGBTQ #Disability | 🏴;311792;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2022-01-23 22:45:35+00:00; ;1485383237874724866;en;21;0;2;1;Twitter for iPhone;@MollyJongFast @theferocity They go everywhere together
column7: Molly. They’re that kind of couple.

column6: MSW | @LSEalumni | #ActuallyAutistic #LGBTQ #Disability | 🏴;311792;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2022-01-23 22:34:59+00:00; ;1485380571698184192;en;9;0;1;0;Twitter for iPhone;@jasonintrator They hang around just waiting to pounce on you because you correctly call out their authoritarianism.
MSW | @LSEalumni | #ActuallyAutistic #LGBTQ #Disability | 🏴;311792;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2022-01-23 22:20:14+00:00; ;1485376857256214539;en;74;0;2;10;Twitter for iPhone;"In retrospect
column7: I wish I’d understood earlier that I was disabled
column8: that what I was experiencing wasn’t transitory.

column1: Constantly expecting—and having others around me expect—an eventual return to baseline was harmful.
You CAN get better—but it might look different than you expect."

column6: MSW | @LSEalumni | #ActuallyAutistic #LGBTQ #Disability | 🏴;311792;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2022-01-23 22:12:56+00:00; ;1485375020998217729;en;73;0;2;9;Twitter for iPhone;"I pray those living with #LongCOVID recover their full cognitive capacities
column7: but I will say that—even after 20 years—I have not.

column2: but I still can’t learn in the same way I used to and I continue to experience executive dysfunction far beyond my baseline ADHD."

column6: MSW | @LSEalumni | #ActuallyAutistic #LGBTQ #Disability | 🏴;311792;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2022-01-23 22:04:35+00:00; ;1485372919773597699;en;3;0;1;0;Twitter for iPhone;@KiekNu I do too. Sending 💜

column1: I took mathematics through Calc II
column2: majored in Economics with a BA magna cum laude
column3: and have had my IQ previously measured in the 99.99%ile.

column1: And I could not add single digits.

column2: but it’s taken a lot of different treatments and many years."

column6: MSW | @LSEalumni | #ActuallyAutistic #LGBTQ #Disability | 🏴;311792;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2022-01-23 21:53:34+00:00; ;1485370147296665600;en;246;2;10;82;Twitter for iPhone;"One reason I’ve been such an advocate for people with #LongCOVID since early 2020–despite not having been infected with SARS-CoV-2 yet myself—is I live disabled from a similar post-viral syndrome.

column1: When I first got sick in 2002
column2: I couldn’t add single digit numbers.

column6: MSW | @LSEalumni | #ActuallyAutistic #LGBTQ #Disability | 🏴;311792;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2022-01-12 22:17:01+00:00; ;1481389780457959429;en;185;0;3;30;Twitter for iPhone;"And arguments about costs are specious when we just approved $750 billion for Defense during peacetime.

column1: It’s my understanding providing these types of non-pharmaceutical interventions has always been a standard part of pandemic planning. It is unconscionable it hasn’t been done."

column6: MSW | @LSEalumni | #ActuallyAutistic #LGBTQ #Disability | 🏴;311792;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2022-01-12 22:07:28+00:00; ;1481387379839717376;en;212;3;3;41;Twitter for iPhone;"The idea the government shouldn’t be held accountable for failing to provide relatively low cost
column7: high-impact non-pharmaceutical interventions like higher quality masks and rapid tests because some people won’t use them is ridiculous on its face.

column6: MSW | @LSEalumni | #ActuallyAutistic #LGBTQ #Disability | 🏴;311792;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2022-01-12 22:05:18+00:00; ;1481386834022305798;en;43;0;2;6;Twitter for iPhone;@SamanthaLeighMc Exactly. If even 50% of those wearing cloth masks had effortless access to higher quality KN95 masks

column1: The failure to respond proportionally to this event is IN ITSELF compounding the trauma experienced by children

column6: MSW | @LSEalumni | #ActuallyAutistic #LGBTQ #Disability | 🏴;311792;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2022-01-12 21:47:11+00:00; ;1481382274939637760;en;62;0;2;8;Twitter for iPhone;"A trauma-informed approach to education was/continues to be necessary.

column1: Teachers are constrained by administrators and leadership are constrained by school boards who are constrained by state and federal mandates.
The @WHCOVIDResponse needs to be more holistic in its approach."

column6: MSW | @LSEalumni | #ActuallyAutistic #LGBTQ #Disability | 🏴;311792;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2022-01-12 21:43:07+00:00; ;1481381248912314374;en;52;0;1;6;Twitter for iPhone;"Public education systems would have done a better service to students (and teachers

column6: MSW | @LSEalumni | #ActuallyAutistic #LGBTQ #Disability | 🏴;311792;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2022-01-12 21:36:17+00:00; ;1481379528945643528;en;88;2;2;25;Twitter for iPhone;"Everyone is living through the pandemic

column1: The impact of collective trauma is more likely to be greater among those already more vulnerable.
Trauma often has a multiplying effect when combined with other relative hardships and objectively adverse experiences."

column1: What’s hardest for me is our being lied to so much.

column9: and and to do my small part to try to reduce suffering.

column1: I know I’m not everyone’s cup of tea. If I’m not yours

column1: If you choose to come at me

column6: MSW | @LSEalumni | #ActuallyAutistic #LGBTQ #Disability | 🏴;311792;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2022-01-08 20:41:56+00:00; ;1479916300088586241;en;64;0;3;3;Twitter for iPhone;"I realize my earnestness makes me an easy target
column7: but—when you attack me—it’s a compliment.

column1: And I don’t bother to engage with people for whom I don’t have some degree of respect.
It’s just not worth the energy or time.

column6: MSW | @LSEalumni | #ActuallyAutistic #LGBTQ #Disability | 🏴;311792;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2022-01-08 20:36:12+00:00; ;1479914857919131656;en;104;2;3;5;Twitter for iPhone;"Here’s the deal:

column1: I’ve survived more than anyone behind any of these named and anonymous accounts can imagine.
I’m also old and autistic af and don’t give a shit what people think about me.
So the trolling is useless—and I can and will flay you intellectually

column6: MSW | @LSEalumni | #ActuallyAutistic #LGBTQ #Disability | 🏴;311792;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2022-01-08 20:33:00+00:00; ;1479914054441443336;en;34;1;4;3;Twitter for iPhone;"Below is an example of a reply to this thread.

column1: This kind of interaction is meant to try to silence people.

column6: MSW | @LSEalumni | #ActuallyAutistic #LGBTQ #Disability | 🏴;311792;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2022-01-08 20:29:48+00:00; ;1479913250259185668;en;57;0;1;3;Twitter for iPhone;"The awareness of the responsibly is why I rarely attack others unless they have *actual* power or unless they appear to me to be purposefully causing harm.

column1: I try to be as supportive as possible and to be honest and transparent.
I also distinguish fact from speculation.

column6: MSW | @LSEalumni | #ActuallyAutistic #LGBTQ #Disability | 🏴;311792;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2022-01-08 20:26:19+00:00; ;1479912370570993672;en;70;1;4;5;Twitter for iPhone;"People get envious of high levels of engagement
column7: which is bizarre to me because I have extremely conflicted feelings about my own visibility.

column1: Many mistakenly see visibility as power
column2: so they feel righteous about lashing out.

column1: The reality is visibility is a responsibility.

column6: MSW | @LSEalumni | #ActuallyAutistic #LGBTQ #Disability | 🏴;311792;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2022-01-08 20:18:12+00:00; ;1479910330008576005;en;49;0;3;3;Twitter for iPhone;"I’ve been made into a caricature by some folks along every part of the political spectrum.

column1: They like to attack me for clout periodically and mock me in their group chats.
I’m not sure what triggered it this time
column2: but it’s probably the viral thread I did about Omicron.
